paper_abstract: Assume that mu(1), mu(2), ..., mu(n) are the eigenvalues of the Laplacian matrix of a graph G. The Laplacian Estrada index of G, is defined as LEE(G) = Sigma(n)(i=1) e(mu i). In this note, we give upper bounds for LEE(G) in terms of connectivity or matching number and characterize the corresponding extremal graphs.
paper_title: On the Laplacian Estrada Index of Graphs
